'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-07-15 04:34:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is not against the patch per se but right now there are two different signatures of the deallocate_fixed_ip function. Mixing that with multiple inheritance seems to be asking for trouble. I'd prefer to use the same signature in RPCAllocateFixedIP and NetworkManager."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2012-07-15 12:11:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree with you, however, I am not very familiar with the remaining of the code in order to complete that refactor and without this, remove-fixed-ip is broken in trunk

I think cleaning it up in a consistent state should be done (and must be), but the issue has to be fixed at least'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-16 15:03:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I agree with Yun that the function signatures should be aligned...'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-07-18 14:07:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Agreed that aligning the signatures would be good, but this patch does at least fix the immediate problem.'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-18 14:26:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Actually, I spent quite some time yesterday looking into this code. It's very convoluted due to the multiple inheritance, agreed.

The problem with this patch, AFAICT, is that by removing the host param, I don't see how the RPCAllocateFixedIP.deallocate_fixed_ip() call can possibly be called correctly, since RPCAllocateFixedIP.deallocate_fixed_ip() is not getting its function signature changed. And because FlatDHCPManager and VLANManager both inherit from RPCAllocateFixedIP as well as NetworkManager (each of which has a different deallocate_fixed_ip() function signature)), I just don't see how the RPCAllocateFixedIP.deallocate_fixed_ip() method is ever called..."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-07-18 15:52:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

removing my +2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2012-07-19 15:20:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Can you please give me a heads up or possibly a hinter at what needs to be done to properly fix this?

I can replicate this in our environment and so far removing that has fixed it for us, then again, we're using FlatManager at the moment.  Perhaps that's where the issue in introduced?"}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-07-23 18:08:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It might be ok to make the host parameter as a keyword style parameter so that it is optional but can be specified when needed. Just a thought..

Yun'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-31 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

commit_message:
Fixed deallocate_fixed_ip call

The deallocate_fixed_ip does not require the host in the call
and it raises an exception when being used with it.

Fixes LP Bug #1024789

Change-Id: Ie5ea872e25d8f26e68e95ee16c3d5ec8c39e5aac

commit_message:
Quantum checks the first address as gateway.

Fixes bug 989920.

Changed gateway checking in favor first address from network
instead of using address ended with .1

Change-Id: Icab9551cdc9a463853dcfce1aca384e6fa814acd

commit_message:
blueprint localfs Local File System Class to Support Extended Capabilities

A new class is proposed that would allow a Data Server to define
optional enhanced capabilities that the Swift Object Server would
be able to use. The first example is to allow a platform to indicate
that its Local File System has been configured with self-healing
mirrored replication, allowing Swift to configure fewer network replicas.

* Add mirror_copies support to RingBuilder.
* swit.common.lfs will be separate project, but for now I add to review
  request.
* LFS middleware can be found here: https://github.com/Nexenta/lfs/

Change-Id: Ia32c9c34c00bfc24be74d87a92da63cddc174d0e

commit_message:
Fix arg to get_instance_volume_block_device_info().

Michael Still caught this bug while reviewing an earlier patch in this
patch series.  This code was passing an instance ID to this function,
but it expects an instance UUID.

Not really related to, but tied up in the patch series
for blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: I3ec871deadd13a8117f16ad46c31b0a9c8a016db

commit_message:
Send a full instance in snapshot_instance.

Change the snapshot_instance method of the compute
rpc API to take a full instance over rpc instead of just
the instance UUID.  This cuts down on database access needed
by nova-compute.

Part of blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: I401beb932e329683c3434ecd643db345aa217492

commit_message:
Send a full instance in set_admin_password.

Change the set_admin_password method of the compute
rpc API to take a full instance over rpc instead of just
the instance UUID.  This cuts down on database access needed
by nova-compute.

Part of blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Iddcc7cb068090faa98f0bb87307e09d5b0ebf0c2

commit_message:
Send a full instance in rollback_live_migration_at_destination.

Change the rollback_live_migration_at_destination method of the compute
rpc API to take a full instance over rpc instead of just
the instance ID.  This cuts down on database access needed
by nova-compute.

This was the last method of this API that was taking an instance ID
as an argument.  There still some left that take the instance UUID,
but I can see the light at the end of the tunnel.

Part of blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Id581d23d36fee5c6fc06d2a655e999fb9aae5ae3

commit_message:
Convert virtual_interfaces to using instance_uuid.

This review converts virtual_interfaces from tracking their
instances with instance_id to using instance_uuid.

This should be the last review for blueprint finish-uuid-conversion.

Change-Id: I303bba009fa37c72394369c8338e6e759f794cd0

commit_message:
Turn on base image cleanup by default.

Essex shipped with the libvirt image cache manager hobbled so it
wouldn't delete unused base images. Its been a while and we haven't
had a new bug reported in ages. Let's turn it on for Folsom. This
is tracked by bug 1029674.

Change-Id: I5529232bf4a316f844d383d5f5a3c0c287d59c1f

commit_message:
Compute: VM-Mode should use instance dict.

Instance dicts no longer support attribute-style access.

Change-Id: Ia5191aa14ad7cc62630bd6b0df8aaccb87e51e03

commit_message:
Adds set_acls function for swift store.

Updates the swift store with working implementation of set_acls.

Updates the base store with an example set_acls function.

This function may be implemented by stores which support backend ACLs
to allow Glance to set read and write ACL's on the store images.

Added tests for swift store function.

Partially implements blueprint: swift-tenant-specific-storage.

Change-Id: I7fbd66b5abf8d27c26bdc5e7d6adc98b5722b647

commit_message:
Send a full instance in resume_instance.

Change the resume_instance method of the compute
rpc API to take a full instance over rpc instead of just
the instance UUID.  This cuts down on database access needed
by nova-compute.

Part of blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: I57789eab047de7ff9b84e2bb5367139a9a7b8e40

commit_message:
Send a full instance in resize_instance.

Change the resize_instance method of the compute
rpc API to take a full instance over rpc instead of just
the instance UUID.  This cuts down on database access needed
by nova-compute.

Part of blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: I5ed8707b2d018559ab4e983f8528dac8377783c7

commit_message:
Send a full instance in reset_network.

Change the reset_network method of the compute
rpc API to take a full instance over rpc instead of just
the instance UUID.  This cuts down on database access needed
by nova-compute.

Part of blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Iaae16e63da9d48d86e3bfc80f6c0cdb9f9bd3ddd

commit_message:
Assert adminness on token validation (bug 1030968)

- Only affects non-PKI tokens

- Includes style changes following bug 1003962
  - Fixed redundant imports & import order
  - Fixed single quote consistency
  - Fixed line continuations
  - Refactored a bit for readability

Change-Id: I2d2566c615919f4968fd5636744fdb613b8fa3ad

commit_message:
Send a full instance in remove_volume_connection.

Change the remove_volume_connection method of the compute
rpc API to take a full instance over rpc instead of just
the instance ID.  This cuts down on database access needed
by nova-compute.

Part of blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: I1bd47b161acd7b6dfb03adb77d00a861f754e188

As the person responsible for the regression in the first place, I agree with this fix.

The problem that is going to happen with this is that the argument of format= leaks into an HTML header. I do not remember exactly which header it is, possibly Content-Type. If the requestor puts a UTF-8 string with non-ASCII characters into format=, it causes WebOb to traceback, because it forces 'ascii' codec for HTML headers (there's no way to override it, because HTML headers must be 7-bit).

If users in the field actually supply weird and random formats, the regression is not acceptable."}]

[{'created': '2012-07-31 02:32:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes regression with format=somethingelse

The WebOb 1.2 support patch introduced a regression where an unknown
format= query used to just default back to plain but now returns a
400. This will break anyone that uses format=text for instance, or
anything else "invalid".

Arguably, it makes the most sense to 400 in the case of an invalid
format requested, but since it is also a backwards compatibility
break, I recommend we keep the previous behavior. Retaining the

Change-Id: I6db015b33a6f3ab239b8cb4a3562ebdba1f76590
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes regression with format=somethingelse

The WebOb 1.2 support patch introduced a regression where an unknown
format= query used to just default back to plain but now returns a
400. This will break anyone that uses format=text for instance, or
anything else "invalid".

Arguably, it makes the most sense to 400 in the case of an invalid
format requested, but since it is also a backwards compatibility
break, I recommend we keep the previous behavior. Retaining the
previous behavior seems less damaging than enforcing the new
behavior.

Change-Id: I6db015b33a6f3ab239b8cb4a3562ebdba1f76590

commit_message:
Fix coverage reporting test.

A change was committed that modified the
glanceclient.common.__init__.py file that seems to conflict with the
NOSE_WITH_COVERAGE environment variable. Run the coverage tests like
novaclient and swiftclient to get around this problem.

Change-Id: Id9a655a0207d3b16a619972ebaecc87387cf784e

commit_message:
Fixes regression with format=somethingelse

The WebOb 1.2 support patch introduced a regression where an unknown
format= query used to just default back to plain but now returns a
400. This will break anyone that uses format=text for instance, or
anything else "invalid".

Arguably, it makes the most sense to 400 in the case of an invalid
format requested, but since it is also a backwards compatibility
break, I recommend we keep the previous behavior. Retaining the
previous behavior seems less damaging than enforcing the new
behavior.

Change-Id: I6db015b33a6f3ab239b8cb4a3562ebdba1f76590

commit_message:
Set default signing_dir based on os USER.

Updates the Keystone auth_token middleware so that it sets the
default signing_dir name base on the OS username obtained
from the environment. This should help resolve potential permissions
issues which can occur when multiple OpenStack services attempt
to use the same signing directory name.

Fixes LP Bug #1031022.

Change-Id: I53bceed27f60721b8f61ffec2d1e91ec2ea464ed

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-30 21:11:15.000000000', 'message': 'Fix image_type=base after snapshot

When an instance is snapshotted, the resultant image should have the
image_type property set to "snapshot".  However, if the base image
already had image_type set to "base", the image_type on the snapshot
will also be set to "base".  This turns out to be because we set
image properties in two different places.  The first is when the
image record is created in glance, which occurs in
nova.compute.api:API._create_image(); this is when image_type is set
to "snapshot".  However, in nova.virt.xenapi.vm_utils:upload_image(),
all the properties from the base image are copied over, so all the
properties set by _create_image() could be overwritten.

The quick solution was to extend the non_inheritable_image_properties
configuration setting to also cover the image properties set by
_create_image().  Long-term, these two metadata-setting processes
need to be more closely unified.  (It should be noted that the
upload_image() function contains a TODO stating that the code should
move into the compute manager, so it can be shared across
hypervisors…)

Fixes bug 1031079.

Change-Id: I936bc147fb823eca67e40084cba5c3bc1a7fe73a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix image_type=base after snapshot

When an instance is snapshotted, the resultant image should have the
image_type property set to "snapshot".  However, if the base image
already had image_type set to "base", the image_type on the snapshot
will also be set to "base".  This turns out to be because we set
image properties in two different places.  The first is when the
image record is created in glance, which occurs in
nova.compute.api:API._create_image(); this is when image_type is set
to "snapshot".  However, in nova.virt.xenapi.vm_utils:upload_image(),
all the properties from the base image are copied over, so all the
properties set by _create_image() could be overwritten.

The quick solution was to extend the non_inheritable_image_properties
configuration setting to also cover the image properties set by
_create_image().  Long-term, these two metadata-setting processes
need to be more closely unified.  (It should be noted that the
upload_image() function contains a TODO stating that the code should
move into the compute manager, so it can be shared across
hypervisors…)

Fixes bug 1031079.

Change-Id: I936bc147fb823eca67e40084cba5c3bc1a7fe73a

commit_message:
ensure libguestfs mounts are cleaned up

Make a few attempts to umount the libguestfs
mounts, in case other processes are accessing
the mounts (like udev etc.)

If we still can't umount after 5 attempts
(with average delay of about 1s between each),
then initiate a lazy umount so that the mounts
might be automatically cleaned up at some stage.
We wait a further 10s after initiating the lazy
umount, before raising an exception.

Addresses the original issue in bug 1013689

Change-Id: Ib5ede9f705c833825a19308c140f99c5bf3a776f
(cherry picked from commit 5eea8879b6f3268dcaba326193bef0ed75470bb7)

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-07-30 21:55:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Do not merge

Ok, it pains me to say this - but I don't think we should take this series of patches into stable/essex

The purpose of the series is primarily to fix bug #988335 - i.e. "Support EC2 CreateImage API for boot-from-volume". As best we can tell, this code never worked at all properly so it's more a case of implementing the feature rather than fixing a bug with it.

While the patch itself is fairly well constrained to just fixing the broken code, it's still a fairly large and complex patch.

The thing that really makes this series a no-go is its dependence on the glance change - I61e96f3fe5f5245fec791170b4a8b4c72135c3de Support zero-size image creation via the v1 API. That's basically a (minor) glance API change, so you'd need to update both glance and nova for this to work. And we weren't planning on releasing glance 2012.1.2 this week along with nova 2012.1.2.

On balance, I think we're better just asking users to wait until Folsom for this one ... unless we see significantly new demand for it.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-07-30 22:03:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

Determined to be out-of-scope for the upcoming stable/essex release.'}]

commit_message:
Reject EC2 CreateImage for instance-store

For fidelity with AWS, we explicitly do not support the EC2 CreateImage
API for the analogue of instance-store-backed instances.

Change-Id: I266a021ce53dbb1f521201f1cdc614b08c31bf8d

commit_message:
EC2 DescribeImages reports correct rootDeviceType

Fixes LP 1024354

A root device type of instance-store was incorrectly reported for
boot-from-volume images (i.e. the analogue of EBS-backed AMIs).

When comparing the block device mapping device name with the root
device name, we now tolerate a missing leading '/dev/' path.

Change-Id: I1d3bda780deee52f5d41e3af041aba7e6305dfde

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-24 15:34:32.000000000', 'message': 'Support EC2 CreateImage API for boot-from-volume

Fixes bug lp 988335

For fidelity with AWS, where the EC2 CreateImage API is only
supported for EBS-backed instances, we now support this API
for booted-from-volume nova servers.

We create a "place-holder" image in glance with the image data
being effectively empty, and the following properties set:

  * the imaged instance's kernel and ramdisk IDs
  * block device mapping containing the appropriate snapshot ID(s)

so that we can boot from this image without providing additional
context (such as via the nova boot --block-device-mapping option)

Change-Id: I0b3d18d7922f2ad1bc687fa88e2f5d4cf5aa068b
'}, {'created': '2012-07-24 16:30:59.000000000', 'message': 'Support EC2 CreateImage API for boot-from-volume

For fidelity with AWS, where the EC2 CreateImage API is only

for booted-from-volume nova servers.

We create a "place-holder" image in glance with the image data
being effectively empty, and the following properties set:

  * the imaged instance's kernel and ramdisk IDs
  * block device mapping containing the appropriate snapshot ID(s)

so that we can boot from this image without providing additional
context (such as via the nova boot --block-device-mapping option)

Change-Id: I0b3d18d7922f2ad1bc687fa88e2f5d4cf5aa068b
'}]
commit_message:
Support EC2 CreateImage API for boot-from-volume

Fixes bug lp 988335

For fidelity with AWS, where the EC2 CreateImage API is only
supported for EBS-backed instances, we now support this API
for booted-from-volume nova servers.

We create a "place-holder" image in glance with the image data
being effectively empty, and the following properties set:

  * the imaged instance's kernel and ramdisk IDs
  * block device mapping containing the appropriate snapshot ID(s)

so that we can boot from this image without providing additional
context (such as via the nova boot --block-device-mapping option)

Change-Id: I0b3d18d7922f2ad1bc687fa88e2f5d4cf5aa068b

commit_message:
Send a full instance in remove_fixed_ip_from_instance.

Change the remove_fixed_ip_from_instance method of the compute
rpc API to take a full instance over rpc instead of just
the instance UUID.  This cuts down on database access needed
by nova-compute.

Part of blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Iee0daf068be9814ef0ba06a69111a45a2e198cbb

commit_message:
Moving where the fixed ip deallocation happens.

Fixes bug 1021352.

In network/manager/deallocate_fixed_ip the call
to mark the IP as no longer allocated occurs before
the call to update security group rules. This means
that if an error occurs in the security group
processing, or if for some reason it is very slow
there is a risk that that the address is reused by
another tenant before the rules relating to this address
have been fully revoked.

Moving the db call to after the call to trigger the
security group refresh would avoid the issue when an
error occurs (the fixed_ip should not be released in
this case).

Change-Id: Iaba1af5c9a17fbbb82e42522b1060773de61550a
(cherry picked from commit 44132acbe91092de1188a3015a2c7155b5ec774c)

commit_message:
Send a full instance in rebuild_instance.

Change the rebuild_instance method of the compute
rpc API to take a full instance over rpc instead of just
the instance UUID.  This cuts down on database access needed
by nova-compute.

This patch also includes fixes for a couple of places that were getting
the instance name using the old instance.name syntax.  It must be
instance['name'].  These no-db-messaging patches are making it so more
code paths have an instance as a dict (received over rpc) instead of
the SQLAlchemy model (looked up from the db on the compute node).

Part of blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: I21647a5a5cbf71a2c498f6fee2e4adbe30b8f2ea

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-26 22:59:43.000000000', 'message': 'Convert remaining network API casts to calls

Fix for Bug 1021340

During compute/terminate_instance networking is de-allocated by a call to
network/api/deallocate_for_instance(), which is implemented as an rpc.cast to
the network manager. This in turn will eventually call
network/manager/deallocate_fixed_ip(), which in turn call the compute API to
trigger a security group refresh, which will get the instance from the database

However because original call to the network manager is a cast there is a chance
that the compute manager will delete the instance record in the DB before the
compute API (in the network manager) tries to retrieve the instance. At this
point the security group refresh fails (leaving rules in place which are a
security risk when the IP is reused), and potentially stopping otheraspects
of the network deallocation from completing.

Changing this from rpc.call to rpc.cast will fix this issue.

Aside from this specific use of a cast there are 4 other casts in the
network API:
  add_fixed_ip_to_instance
  remove_fixed_ip_from_instance
  add_network_to_project
  release_floating_ip

and to avoid other timing issues these will also be converted to calls.

Change-Id: I5cdcc628293d3e7cf165c5ffe4883f138783f73f
(cherry picked from commit 34f9d7e974d0e09c723e0a04ed6eecd1b482e77d)
'}, {'created': '2012-07-27 01:20:46.000000000', 'message': 'Convert remaining network API casts to calls

compute API (in the network manager) tries to retrieve the instance. At this
point the security group refresh fails (leaving rules in place which are a
security risk when the IP is reused), and potentially stopping otheraspects
of the network deallocation from completing.

Changing this from rpc.call to rpc.cast will fix this issue.

Aside from this specific use of a cast there are 4 other casts in the
network API:
  add_fixed_ip_to_instance
  remove_fixed_ip_from_instance
  add_network_to_project
  release_floating_ip

and to avoid other timing issues these will also be converted to calls.

Change-Id: I5cdcc628293d3e7cf165c5ffe4883f138783f73f
(cherry picked from commit 34f9d7e974d0e09c723e0a04ed6eecd1b482e77d)
'}]
commit_message:
Convert remaining network API casts to calls

Fix for Bug 1021340

During compute/terminate_instance networking is de-allocated by a call to
network/api/deallocate_for_instance(), which is implemented as an rpc.cast to
the network manager. This in turn will eventually call
network/manager/deallocate_fixed_ip(), which in turn call the compute API to
trigger a security group refresh, which will get the instance from the database

However because original call to the network manager is a cast there is a chance
that the compute manager will delete the instance record in the DB before the
compute API (in the network manager) tries to retrieve the instance. At this
point the security group refresh fails (leaving rules in place which are a
security risk when the IP is reused), and potentially stopping otheraspects
of the network deallocation from completing.

Changing this from rpc.call to rpc.cast will fix this issue.

Aside from this specific use of a cast there are 4 other casts in the
network API:
  add_fixed_ip_to_instance
  remove_fixed_ip_from_instance
  add_network_to_project
  release_floating_ip

and to avoid other timing issues these will also be converted to calls.

Change-Id: I5cdcc628293d3e7cf165c5ffe4883f138783f73f
(cherry picked from commit 34f9d7e974d0e09c723e0a04ed6eecd1b482e77d)

commit_message:
Adding networking rules to vm's on compute service startup

Fixes bug 1027105

Restarting nova-compute resulted in a new empty iptables chain
"nova-compute-FORWARD" being create. This commit adds a single
call to plug_vifs which ensures the appropriate filters (and
bridge) are present on service startup.

Change-Id: I51cbb56acbb244ddddd951a26d3168cf5a9c0314
(cherry picked from commit c2e957ceb555b88084033d9a1c15a4f338b1476e)

commit_message:
Ensure Content-Type is JSON-like where necessary

Several API calls were returning text/html as the content-type, when
the body was actually encoded as JSON. This ensures the places where
that was happening set content-type to 'application/json'.

Fixes bug 1030730

Change-Id: Iae9ed9ca798186a0663bdee1988f3acee6906db5

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-30 12:48:55.000000000', 'message': "Avoid error during snapshot of ISO booted instance

Fixes bug #1023492

If you boot an instance from an image with disk_format=iso and then
attempt to snapshot (i.e. nova image-create) you currently get a
traceback because we do:

  qemu-img convert -f qcow2 -O iso -s $snap $disk $out

and 'iso' is not a format that qemu-img knows anything about.

When booting the image, we use qemu-img to detect that the file is
a raw image so we avoid having to special case disk_format=iso
there. However, there's no way of avoiding the special casing when
extracting a snapshot.

Note 1 - it's not very clever to take a snapshot of a read-only
disk downloaded from glance and upload it back to glance again.
Adding such smarts would be a nice enhancement.

Note 2 - only the destination format is important here because
we can only be extracting from a qcow2 image since snapshots
only work where use_cow_images=True. See also #1030844.

Change-Id: I21ff6db8ebb59a83d27f224283fb76f582c38a0e
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid error during snapshot of ISO booted instance

Fixes bug #1023492

If you boot an instance from an image with disk_format=iso and then
attempt to snapshot (i.e. nova image-create) you currently get a
traceback because we do:

  qemu-img convert -f qcow2 -O iso -s $snap $disk $out

and 'iso' is not a format that qemu-img knows anything about.

When booting the image, we use qemu-img to detect that the file is
a raw image so we avoid having to special case disk_format=iso
there. However, there's no way of avoiding the special casing when
extracting a snapshot.

Note 1 - it's not very clever to take a snapshot of a read-only
disk downloaded from glance and upload it back to glance again.
Adding such smarts would be a nice enhancement.

Note 2 - only the destination format is important here because
we can only be extracting from a qcow2 image since snapshots
only work where use_cow_images=True. See also #1030844.

Change-Id: I21ff6db8ebb59a83d27f224283fb76f582c38a0e

commit_message:
Dont show stack trace on command line for service error.

- Fix bug 996648

Currently if the Registry service is not running, any glance command
will show the Internal server error exception response body on the command line.
This fix proposes to hide that trace with a more generic message. Users can
still see the trace on log file in debug.

Change-Id: Ia86c42002ae8daabe0d7ad92a2017f1869b10853

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-30 18:14:48.000000000', 'message': 'heat engine : Avoid writing to class-scope parameters schema

Fixes issue where multiple instances of the same resource types
which have different parameters break, because the parser is
writing back to the class-scope properties_schema which should
be immutable.  This patch fixes by making a per-instance copy.

Fixes #183

Change-Id: Ia29f67465acbcfaf8dfe511ddaa9075bc48157ad
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat engine : Avoid writing to class-scope parameters schema

Fixes issue where multiple instances of the same resource types
which have different parameters break, because the parser is
writing back to the class-scope properties_schema which should
be immutable.  This patch fixes by making a per-instance copy.

Fixes #183

Change-Id: Ia29f67465acbcfaf8dfe511ddaa9075bc48157ad
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Tolerate set_admin_password not implemented.

Allow skipping of password test if this action
is not implemented by the virt driver.

Must wait for https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10215/1

This will allow the following nova patch to be gated:

https://review.openstack.org/10130

Change-Id: I4a83b473edf427e1243a96292a27a28b8968bec8

Update getting started with credential crypto

We encrypt the sensitive information in the database now. This updates
the Getting Started guide to generate an encryption key.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-30 15:23:27.000000000', 'message': "don't throw exceptions if %(color)s tag is used

fixed bug #1030078

If the log format strings include the %(color)s key in them and you
enable file logging, your log files won't work, and instead you'll
see exceptions on the console as the default python log handler doesn't
support that keyword.

This approach stubs out the extra keywords to be empty strings to avoid
the KeyError. Tests are also added to demonstrate the KeyError as defined
behavior, and test that color codes can be passed.

Change-Id: Ia5dbaee9c530e243e2121667c8a54e6f9d66e1e7
"}]
commit_message:
don't throw exceptions if %(color)s tag is used

fixed bug #1030078

If the log format strings include the %(color)s key in them and you
enable file logging, your log files won't work, and instead you'll
see exceptions on the console as the default python log handler doesn't
support that keyword.

This approach stubs out the extra keywords to be empty strings to avoid
the KeyError. Tests are also added to demonstrate the KeyError as defined
behavior, and test that color codes can be passed.

Change-Id: Ia5dbaee9c530e243e2121667c8a54e6f9d66e1e7

[{'created': '2012-07-30 04:18:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix --debug CLI option

The --debug argument has been ignored since httplib2 was replaced
with httplib. This re-enables the --debug flag as an equivalent
to the env var GLANCECLIENT_DEBUG.

Fixes bug 1030700

Change-Id: Ib653049eea2f18c4cc2f8f8aac7884245afd0f04

Fixes bug 1030700

Change-Id: Ib653049eea2f18c4cc2f8f8aac7884245afd0f04
'}]
commit_message:
Fix --debug CLI option

The --debug argument has been ignored since httplib2 was replaced
with httplib. This re-enables the --debug flag as an equivalent
to the env var GLANCECLIENT_DEBUG.

Fixes bug 1030700

Change-Id: Ib653049eea2f18c4cc2f8f8aac7884245afd0f04

commit_message:
Add a link from HACKING to wiki GitCommitMessages page

The HACKING file contains a short example of an effective
commit message. For reasons for space, it cannot describe
the rationale behind this example. It also does not have
space to describe how to split up a patch into a series
of commits. Add a link from the HACKING file to the wiki

   http://wiki.openstack.org/GitCommitMessages

where further information can be found

Change-Id: I34d44485486b623b11743106f09d5ef631d35888

commit_message:
fix the qpid_heartbeat option so that it's effective

The 'hearbeat' typo caused this setting to be ineffective.
This bug has been present since the initial nova qpid implementation.

Fixes bug: 1030430
Change-Id: Ibb9d7484b9d11a6904cc9e2a8dde6d9164ee05b1

commit_message:
Check for selinux before setting up selinux.

Check to see if /etc/selinux exists before trying
to setup ssh keys for selinux. If it doesnt exist
it will result in a traceback when setting up the image
since the directory doesnt exist on Ubuntu.

Fixes LP: #1030609

Change-Id: I8af1e6232bc5a84cbb878c2663ab30eb4139484c
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

subject: Agent Update Fallback
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 100, 'name': 'Johannes Erdfelt', 'email': 'johannes@erdfelt.com', 'username': 'johannes.erdfelt'}, {'_account_id': 475, 'name': 'Rick Harris', 'email': 'rick.harris@rackspace.com', 'username': 'rconradharris'}, {'_account_id': 782, 'name': 'John Garbutt', 'email': 'john@johngarbutt.com', 'username': 'johngarbutt'}, {'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1247, 'name': 'Mark McLoughlin', 'email': 'markmc@redhat.com', 'username': 'markmc'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 2535, 'name': 'renukaapte', 'email': 'renuka.apte@citrix.com', 'username': 'renukaapte'}]

"}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2012-07-14 20:35:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2012-07-14 20:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-14 21:26:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/3881/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-07-19 11:36:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Looks fairly reasonable to me, but I don't know much about the details of the guest agent used with XenServer. Adding various xenapi driver folks to the review."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-07-19 11:36:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-19 12:44:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This looks like a good step forward to me.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-19 13:13:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

Missed a file. Not sure you need to change that timeout."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2012-07-19 15:18:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi John,

The reasoning behind this was that with some operating systems, the initial call would take far longer than expected if it fails, so what would happen is the following

- Agent update times out after 30 seconds
- Nova skips agent update, requests for admin password reset
- Admin password reset fails to complete in 30 seconds because the process is still "stuck" attempting to retrieve the agent file (but unable to connect)
- The admin password reset fails, if the admin password reset fails, the server is automatically marked as ERROR and destroyed

I saw this behaviour mostly with Debian-based systems where they would take longer to timeout, therefore the server build never fails.  I don't see any harm of increasing the timeout other than the extra time it might take, in the event something isn't completing properly.

Please let me know if I missed anything else otherwise.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-07-19 17:06:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I wonder if the agent update should *always* be after resetnetwork.

Also -1 on the agent timeout update at this time."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2012-07-19 17:21:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

The reasoning why I wanted to keep both available is in the event that some other users such as the ones using FlatDHCP probably wanted the agent to update before anything (let's say that the agent is broken, or doesn't do things correctly, like set the password)"}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-07-19 20:27:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-07-19 20:28:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Oops, didn't mean to submit so quickly.

I'm fine with trying again, especially since if it's the first boot, there will likely be no network until after the resetnetwork command.

I don't like updating the timeout like that. I think an argument could be made to configure that in nova and then push the timeout to the agent plugin instead of hardcoding it however."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2012-07-19 20:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

What do you think of modifying the agent plugin to take a timeout as an optional argument, defaulting to 30s (so not all the code has to be changed to use a timeout), and then for calls where we know they might take longer, we can force the agent update to 60s or so in the plugin call

Let me know if this sounds good'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2012-07-20 05:45:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

So after further testing, I have found a large amount on inconstancies between OS to OS (CentOS 5 would timeout even with the 60 seconds).

Does everyone think it's okay to switch the timeout back to 30 seconds and update the agent after reset_network ?"}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-20 08:59:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I thought the agent timeout was already controlled by this flag:
xenapi_agent_opts = [
    cfg.IntOpt('agent_version_timeout',
               default=300,
               help='number of seconds to wait for agent '
                    'to be fully operational'),
]

See this code:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/xenapi/agent.py#L100"}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2012-07-20 13:34:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi John,

That variable controls the timeout until the detection of the agent (the first response of the version call).  Any further calls use the 30 second timeout initially imposed

The way that 300 second timeout works is that it actually runs an agent version, if it times out within 30 seconds, it tries again until it counts up to 300 seconds (so 10 failures) and it'll fail."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-28 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-07-28 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-07-30 09:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I agree with your comment about the version flag, but I think we could use the same flag for both cases, and probably re-use the same bit of code if that makes sense.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-14 20:07:03.000000000', 'message': 'Agent Update Fallback

In some cases, such as using the FlatManager, the agent may not
have any internet connectivity.  Therefore, it would fail to
download the agent package and never update successfully.

This fixes it by trying to update right after checking the
version, in the event that the update fails, we try again
after we reset the network (where we should have network
connectivity at that point).

The agent timeout has been increased because some operating
systems (mostly Debian-based) have longer network timeouts,
therefore the agent would be stuck trying to download and not
respond to further commands such as the admin password reset
and it would lead the server to be terminated.

Change-Id: Ia13e805d7a9a509926556cbd3116cf2487f9d6fa
'}, {'created': '2012-07-14 20:08:41.000000000', 'message': 'Agent Update Fallback

In some cases, such as using the FlatManager, the agent may not
have any internet connectivity.  Therefore, it would fail to
download the agent package and never update successfully.

This fixes it by trying to update right after checking the
version, in the event that the update fails, we try again
after we reset the network (where we should have network
connectivity at that point).  Fixes LP Bug #1024786

The agent timeout has been increased because some operating
systems (mostly Debian-based) have longer network timeouts,
therefore the agent would be stuck trying to download and not
respond to further commands such as the admin password reset
and it would lead the server to be terminated.

Change-Id: Ia13e805d7a9a509926556cbd3116cf2487f9d6fa
'}, {'created': '2012-07-14 20:35:24.000000000', 'message': 'Agent Update Fallback

In some cases, such as using the FlatManager, the agent may not
have any internet connectivity.  Therefore, it would fail to
download the agent package and never update successfully.

This fixes it by trying to update right after checking the
version, in the event that the update fails, we try again
after we reset the network (where we should have network
connectivity at that point).  Fixes LP Bug #1024786

The agent timeout has been increased because some operating
systems (mostly Debian-based) have longer network timeouts,
therefore the agent would be stuck trying to download and not
respond to further commands such as the admin password reset
and it would lead the server to be terminated.

Change-Id: Ia13e805d7a9a509926556cbd3116cf2487f9d6fa

commit_message:
Agent Update Fallback

In some cases, such as using the FlatManager, the agent may not
have any internet connectivity.  Therefore, it would fail to
download the agent package and never update successfully.

This fixes it by trying to update right after checking the
version, in the event that the update fails, we try again
after we reset the network (where we should have network
connectivity at that point).  Fixes LP Bug #1024786

The agent timeout has been increased because some operating
systems (mostly Debian-based) have longer network timeouts,
therefore the agent would be stuck trying to download and not
respond to further commands such as the admin password reset
and it would lead the server to be terminated.

Change-Id: Ia13e805d7a9a509926556cbd3116cf2487f9d6fa

commit_message:
EC2 DescribeImageAttribute by kernel/ramdisk.

Fixes bug 1026898.

Supports kernel/ramdisk attributes for EC2 DescribeImageAttribute API to
display the ID of the kernel/ramdisk associated with the AMI. And adds
test cases to verify this behavior.

Change-Id: I3ea91b95812dcec349b4ff6dc889645a57975278

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-30 00:52:34.000000000', 'message': "Logging improvements: handoffs and thread locals

A warning log line is emitted whenever the proxy has to use a handoff
node. Monitoring these warnings can indicate a problem within your
cluster; however, you can disable these log lines by setting the
proxy conf's log_handoffs to false.

While working on this, I also noticed why many proxy log lines did
not have txn_id and client_ip -- subcoroutines. Now the logger thread
locals are copied to the subcoroutines.

Change-Id: I67af14b5c3d70f313922828a588ed239c620cdfa
"}]
commit_message:
Logging improvements: handoffs and thread locals

A warning log line is emitted whenever the proxy has to use a handoff
node. Monitoring these warnings can indicate a problem within your
cluster; however, you can disable these log lines by setting the
proxy conf's log_handoffs to false.

While working on this, I also noticed why many proxy log lines did
not have txn_id and client_ip -- subcoroutines. Now the logger thread
locals are copied to the subcoroutines.

Change-Id: I67af14b5c3d70f313922828a588ed239c620cdfa

commit_message:
Logging improvements: handoffs and thread locals

A warning log line is emitted whenever the proxy has to use a handoff
node. Monitoring these warnings can indicate a problem within your
cluster; however, you can disable these log lines by setting the
proxy conf's log_handoffs to false.

While working on this, I also noticed why many proxy log lines did
not have txn_id and client_ip -- subcoroutines. Now the logger thread
locals are copied to the subcoroutines.

Change-Id: Ibac086e1b985f566c068d083620287509de35da8

commit_message:
Logging improvements: handoffs and thread locals

A warning log line is emitted whenever the proxy has to use a handoff
node. Monitoring these warnings can indicate a problem within your
cluster; however, you can disable these log lines by setting the
proxy conf's log_handoffs to false.

While working on this, I also noticed why many proxy log lines did
not have txn_id and client_ip -- subcoroutines. Now the logger thread
locals are copied to the subcoroutines.

Change-Id: Ibac086e1b985f566c068d083620287509de35da8

Seems fine to me.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-07-29 04:47:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

This is an awesome fix. I'm holding back on +2ing because I want to know if it will break existing dhcp-option files. If you have a file that has no tag on your options, will it apply to all networks?"}, {'account_id': 1007, 'date': '2012-07-29 06:05:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Vish, the patch will apply existing dhcp-option settings that don't specify a tag to ALL networks; in other words the existing behaviour that we already have will NOT change if you don't specify a tag.

For instance, running with the patch I have dnsmasq running like so:

/usr/sbin/dnsmasq --strict-order --bind-interfaces --conf-file=/etc/dnsmasq.nova.conf --domain=novalocal --pid-file=/opt/stack/nova/networks/nova-br100.pid --listen-address=10.0.0.1 --except-interface=lo --dhcp-range=set:'private',10.0.0.3,static,120s --dhcp-lease-max=256 --dhcp-hostsfile=/opt/stack/nova/networks/nova-br100.conf --dhcp-script=/opt/stack/nova/bin/nova-dhcpbridge --leasefile-ro

My /etc/dnsmasq.nova.conf contains the following, not specifying a tag:
dhcp-option=option:router,10.0.0.254
dhcp-option=option:ntp-server,10.0.0.253
dhcp-option=option:dns-server,8.8.8.8

In this config, all instances regardless of network label/tag have the dhcp options set from the dnsmasq config file."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-07-29 21:11:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

awesome, thatnks for the explanation'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-29 23:37:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-28 18:52:23.000000000', 'message': "Support external gateways in VLAN mode.

Add network label when starting dnsmasq. Fixes bug 1012443.

To allow for per-network dnsmasq customization we can use the network
label from the database as the dnsmasq network tag. A user can then
specify a custom dnsmasq config file using the 'dnsmasq_config_file'
configuration flag.

An example dnsmasq config file showing how to set a custom external
gateway or ntp server for particular networks based on their tag/label
follows:

dhcp-option=tag:'private',option:router,10.0.0.254
dhcp-option=tag:'private',option:ntp-server,10.0.0.253
dhcp-option=tag:'private',option:dns-server,8.8.8.8

dhcp-option=tag:'blue',option:router,10.10.0.254
dhcp-option=tag:'blue',option:ntp-server,10.10.0.253
dhcp-option=tag:'blue',option:dns-server,8.8.4.4

Change-Id: I56cb175a968e33b803dfcb965f90f3a5ca4983ca
"}]
commit_message:
Support external gateways in VLAN mode.

Add network label when starting dnsmasq. Fixes bug 1012443.

To allow for per-network dnsmasq customization we can use the network
label from the database as the dnsmasq network tag. A user can then
specify a custom dnsmasq config file using the 'dnsmasq_config_file'
configuration flag.

An example dnsmasq config file showing how to set a custom external
gateway or ntp server for particular networks based on their tag/label
follows:

dhcp-option=tag:'private',option:router,10.0.0.254
dhcp-option=tag:'private',option:ntp-server,10.0.0.253
dhcp-option=tag:'private',option:dns-server,8.8.8.8

dhcp-option=tag:'blue',option:router,10.10.0.254
dhcp-option=tag:'blue',option:ntp-server,10.10.0.253
dhcp-option=tag:'blue',option:dns-server,8.8.4.4

Change-Id: I56cb175a968e33b803dfcb965f90f3a5ca4983ca

commit_message:
Clarify libvirt DHCP networking re unused int'face

fixed bug 1023942

The text contained instructions on using a spare interface for the
flatDHCP networking. There are two ways to do this - specify it as
the flat_interface, or add it to the bridge manually.

This change separates the two to make this clearer.

Change-Id: I002f6d590b2e0dbff8ab942205d01c2e9cb0e267

commit_message:
Make quantum pipeline configurable from quantum.conf.

Fixes bug 1029313.

The current api-paste.ini does not provide a way to choose a pipeline:
there is no way to switching a pipeline between keystone-enabled and
noauth pipelines without modifying the pipeline directly.

This commit introduces 'auth_strategy' flag to quantum.conf and
a pipeline used is determined depending on the flag. Supported values for
this flag are 'keystone' (default) and 'noauth' at the moment.

Change-Id: Ieafaf31eaaec2b02727ed5d3bd36c907e50aee5b

commit_message:
Only delete VLAN information after Quantum network is deleted

Fixes bug 1030271

In the case where a network is deleted and there is a VLAN tag in a
separate table then the tag should only be deleted if the network
is deleted.

Change-Id: I99130f863928abf30a521e9a2b6d1233a274d9c6

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-28 20:22:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix CoreFilter setting to avoid overallocation

cherry-picked 2372bf2a63fbf75c53b2686fb97735448896b4c2
as I was very surprised by the undocumented behaviour
I would really like to see this patch in stable/essex

Tom Fifield's orignal commit message for my patch to master:

From Jon Proulx (jproulx), who is still awaiting approval:

"Only schedule instances on hosts if there are sufficient CPU
cores available. If this filter is not set, the scheduler may
overprovision a host based on cores"

but in reality cpu_allocation_ratio must also be set with this
 filter. According to http://docs.openstack.org/essex/openstack-
compute/admin/content/compute-options-reference.html
 cpu_allocation_ratio defaults to 16.0 meaning cpu will be
 overprovisioned by 16:1 to get the behaviour described
 cpu_allocation_ratio must be set to 1.0

fixes bug 1027309

Change-Id: Ieea6c5ab13ce3514e508e4ad3799253d348b64d4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix CoreFilter setting to avoid overallocation

cherry-picked 2372bf2a63fbf75c53b2686fb97735448896b4c2
as I was very surprised by the undocumented behaviour
I would really like to see this patch in stable/essex

Tom Fifield's orignal commit message for my patch to master:

From Jon Proulx (jproulx), who is still awaiting approval:

"Only schedule instances on hosts if there are sufficient CPU
cores available. If this filter is not set, the scheduler may
overprovision a host based on cores"

but in reality cpu_allocation_ratio must also be set with this
 filter. According to http://docs.openstack.org/essex/openstack-
compute/admin/content/compute-options-reference.html
 cpu_allocation_ratio defaults to 16.0 meaning cpu will be
 overprovisioned by 16:1 to get the behaviour described
 cpu_allocation_ratio must be set to 1.0

fixes bug 1027309

Change-Id: Ieea6c5ab13ce3514e508e4ad3799253d348b64d4

I may be biased because I filed https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9582/ but this is clearly wrong. SSL certificates won't be validated regardless of the existance of a trust-store. commit_message:
Allows skipping server certificate validation.

If there is no OS_CA_CERT specified, this client will skip Keystone
server certificate validation.  This fixes bug 1012591.

[{'created': '2012-07-27 23:49:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix state logic for auto-confirm resizes

In the compute manager, the _poll_unconfirmed_resizes() periodic
task mishandled state checks, and would call confirm_resize() in
invalid states.  This patch fixes the logic so that confirm_resize()
is only called if the instance is in vm_state 'resized' and
task_state None.  The unit test is also fixed for the proper logic.

Fixes bug 1030175.

Change-Id: I66028b7042d88fb0f1f41df07f42b4b02cf60247
"}]
commit_message:
Fix state logic for auto-confirm resizes

In the compute manager, the _poll_unconfirmed_resizes() periodic
task mishandled state checks, and would call confirm_resize() in
invalid states.  This patch fixes the logic so that confirm_resize()
is only called if the instance is in vm_state 'resized' and
task_state None.  The unit test is also fixed for the proper logic.

Fixes bug 1030175.

Change-Id: I66028b7042d88fb0f1f41df07f42b4b02cf60247

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-27 15:52:35.000000000', 'message': "Add persistent volumes for tgtd.

Currently if you restart the server running nova-volume
or restart tgt, you will loose your iscsi targets that
have been created. This is not good.

In order for iscsi targets to be persistent across
reboots or restarts, one has to have the target's configuration
information in /etc/tgt/targets.conf or /etc/tgt/conf.d.
So when tgtd is restarted then the iscsi targets will be there
as expected.

This patch will add a configuration file to $state_path/volumes
when the volume is created. The configuration file is identified by
the volume uuid. It creates a logicalunit when the volume is created
as well. The iscsi target and configuration file
will be removed once the volume has been removed as well.

In order to use this, you have to include the following in
your /etc/tgt/targets.conf

include $state_path/volumes/*

For upgrades, it will just re-create the volumes
already in the volumes table.

Fixes LP: #1011159

Change-Id: I38fc096ab881ccb52cb688ae46d9d36b0a7b3a45
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
"}, {'created': '2012-07-27 19:25:27.000000000', 'message': "Add persistent volumes for tgtd.

Currently if you restart the server running nova-volume
or restart tgt, you will loose your iscsi targets that
have been created. This is not good.

In order for iscsi targets to be persistent across
reboots or restarts, one has to have the target's configuration
information in /etc/tgt/targets.conf or /etc/tgt/conf.d.
So when tgtd is restarted then the iscsi targets will be there
as expected.

This patch will add a configuration file to $state_path/volumes
when the volume is created. The configuration file is identified by
the volume uuid. It creates a logicalunit when the volume is created
as well. The iscsi target and configuration file
will be removed once the volume has been removed as well.

In order to use this, you have to include the following in
your /etc/tgt/targets.conf

include $state_path/volumes/*

For upgrades, it will just re-create the volumes
already in the volumes table.

Fixes LP: #1011159

Change-Id: I38fc096ab881ccb52cb688ae46d9d36b0a7b3a45
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Add persistent volumes for tgtd.

Currently if you restart the server running nova-volume
or restart tgt, you will loose your iscsi targets that
have been created. This is not good.

In order for iscsi targets to be persistent across
reboots or restarts, one has to have the target's configuration
information in /etc/tgt/targets.conf or /etc/tgt/conf.d.
So when tgtd is restarted then the iscsi targets will be there
as expected.

This patch will add a configuration file to $state_path/volumes
when the volume is created. The configuration file is identified by
the volume uuid. It creates a logicalunit when the volume is created
as well. The iscsi target and configuration file
will be removed once the volume has been removed as well.

In order to use this, you have to include the following in
your /etc/tgt/targets.conf

include $state_path/volumes/*

For upgrades, it will just re-create the volumes
already in the volumes table.

Fixes LP: #1011159

Change-Id: I38fc096ab881ccb52cb688ae46d9d36b0a7b3a45
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fix wrong regex in cleanup_file_locks.

The sentinel filename actually has form hostname-threadid.pid,
not hostname.threadid-pid.

Launchpad bug 1018586.

Update: Add Eugene to Authors for stable/essex.

Change-Id: I09c01e0e63ee704b1485c196dc0b396ee03b2e5c
(cherry picked from commit 974417b75f5f839ce4daaf080147ad154d727f10)

commit_message:
Troubleshooting packet drops across bridge with VLAN

Added a section in troubleshooting networking related to packets
being dropped in VLAN mode.

Docs are based on this blog post:
http://buriedlede.blogspot.com/2012/07/debugging-networking-problems-with.html

Fixed a typo "sometimes"

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10106/

Change-Id: Iba56085703a98154b3035122f8ab3b36b5cbe41d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-27 22:02:06.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly send primitive instances via rpc.

This fixes a few bugs in recent no-db-messaging commits.  There were a
few places that I accidentally still used "instance" where I should have
used "instance_p", which is the instance converted to primitive types.

I noticed the problem looking at smokestack logs.  I saw a Qpid
traceback that indicated the problem.  As an interesting point, systems
using Kombu would not have seen this problem.  Kombu uses anyjson.  Our
jsonutils module sets anyjson to go through jsonutils, which will
automatically to jsonutils.to_primitive() if needed to serialize an
object.  Qpid doesn't do json serialization, so it will blow up if it
hits a non-primitive type.  Yay for testing multiple different
configurations to find problems.

Part of blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: I3487195110572b7ae9586cfcc618ab7ab28d5017
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly send primitive instances via rpc.

This fixes a few bugs in recent no-db-messaging commits.  There were a
few places that I accidentally still used "instance" where I should have
used "instance_p", which is the instance converted to primitive types.

I noticed the problem looking at smokestack logs.  I saw a Qpid
traceback that indicated the problem.  As an interesting point, systems
using Kombu would not have seen this problem.  Kombu uses anyjson.  Our
jsonutils module sets anyjson to go through jsonutils, which will
automatically to jsonutils.to_primitive() if needed to serialize an
object.  Qpid doesn't do json serialization, so it will blow up if it
hits a non-primitive type.  Yay for testing multiple different
configurations to find problems.

Part of blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: I3487195110572b7ae9586cfcc618ab7ab28d5017

The naming used in the class of the  'guest' object is intended to map directly to libvirt terminology. So guest.os_type is appropriate here, even if Nova uses 'vm_mode' itself.

I've posted a change which attempts to clearly define the valid 'vm_mode' values across all drivers, instead of having each driver go their own way

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10273/"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-07-25 13:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12:

> By tagging an image with "vm_mode=exe", for example, we'll be able to allow it to be placed on any libvirt hypervisor supporting container based virt

That makes a lot of sense, thanks.

Do you have any concerns about potential mismatches between vm_mode and libvirt type? e.g. if we don't check that a given vm_mode makes sense for the current libvirt_type? I'd be happier if we were defensive about this until the scheduler is doing the correct placement.'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-07-25 13:44:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Needs rebasing onto danpb's vm_mode stuff - I23efc5dc"}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2012-07-25 13:49:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

Will rebase as soon as danpb's vm_mode stuff is merged."}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-07-25 13:57:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

> Do you have any concerns about potential mismatches between vm_mode
> and libvirt type? e.g. if we don't check that a given vm_mode makes
> sense for the current libvirt_type? I'd be happier if we were
> defensive about this until the scheduler is doing the correct placement.

Libvirt will actually validate this data immediately during parsing of the XML. It does this by comparing the requested os_type in the XML, against what the hypervisor has declared it supports in the capabilities. So even if OpenStack doesn't  yet use the capabilities XML, we'll get pretty reasonable validation by libvirt."}, {'account_id': 1119, 'date': '2012-07-25 22:09:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-25 22:27:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
libvirt driver: set os_type to support xen hvm/pv

Generate libvirt config for xen hvm and pv guests based on instance
vm_mode. The vm_mode can be set via the vm_mode image property.

Use hvmloader for vm_mode.HVM guests. libvirt_type xen still defaults to
vm_mode.XEN (pv), to not change any behavior.

Change-Id: I5f92bedf6588ab2674d784772a5ecdb895fabe40

I think we use 202 for creation of instances, so I would think 202 > 201 here."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-07-20 21:07:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-20 11:18:19.000000000', 'message': '201 status and location header on volume creation

Fixes LP 1026600

Previously a 200 OK status was returned when a new volume is POST'd
and the location header was left unset.

Now it is arguable whether the appropriate status is "202 Accepted"
(as the volume is not immediately available for use) or "201 Created"
(as the volume has been successfully created in the nova DB).
However it is clear that normal RESTful idiom would not involve
returning a "200 OK" status when a new resource is created.

There is already substantial code duplication between the volumes API
and the os-volumes API extension - this will be addressed in a later
patch.

Change-Id: I166846a4cfea8adc8c156b8ae0e0d288681ac08c
'}, {'created': '2012-07-20 13:36:09.000000000', 'message': '201 status and location header on volume creation

commit_message:
Return location header on volume creation

Partially addresses LP 1026600

Normal RESTful idiom would dictate that the "Location" header is set
to reference the newly created resource.

We defer lining up the status code returned with generally accepted
RESTful convention (currently "200 OK", should be "201 Created" or
"202 Accepted") until the next API major version bump.

There is already substantial code duplication between the volumes API
and the os-volumes API extension - this will be addressed in a later
patch.

Change-Id: I166846a4cfea8adc8c156b8ae0e0d288681ac08c

commit_message:
Allow _destroy_vdis if a mapping has no VDI

In _destroy_vdis() in the xenapi vmops.py, a list of VDIs to not
destroy is collected.  If one of the block device mappings does
not have a corresponding VDI, however, _destroy_vdis() fails
(KeyError('vdi_uuid') is raised).  This interferes with
instance deletion.  The problem is corrected by skipping mappings
for which the connection_info data does not contain 'vdi_uuid'.

Fixes bug 1030143.

Change-Id: I5125d557ab799fcf572f665523cd07a893ad3b90

subject: Honor '--insecure' commandline flag also for keystone authentication
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-18 09:13:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-merge/1343/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-pep8/1466/consoleFull : SUCCESS

"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-18 14:37:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Let's call this flag something else. How about --insecure-auth?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-18 14:59:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

That's even misleading, how about --insecure-keystone-verification or something?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-18 15:04:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2012-07-19 07:33:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

--insecure-auth could be ok, but the --insecure flag is already used to talk against SSL-secured glance with self-signed certificates. However, both would disable cert validity checking, so why two names for the same thing?

So if both glance and keystone use self-signed certs, you would have to issue the following:

glance --ssl --insecure --insecure-auth index

rather chatty, isn't it?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-19 16:38:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I actually made a bad assumption about what this was doing...I was thinking it was for the service talking to keystone, not the client. 

So with that newfound knowledge, I want to ask if the case could ever exist that one would need to control insecurity separately for talking to the glance service vs talking to the keystone service?'}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2012-07-20 07:41:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't think so, most setups would want to put every *-api service behind SSL or none. But this flag modifies client behavior regardless of which service it speaks to. So either it validates all certificates or none, I don't see any valid reason to validate only some."}, {'account_id': 4375, 'date': '2012-07-20 07:44:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-20 08:00:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Ok, let's move forward with your original plan to use --insecure for both. commit_message:
Honor '--insecure' commandline flag also for keystone authentication

Currently, keystone auth fails with self-signed certificates. This patch
essentially passes this value down to KeystoneStrategy._do_request. This
way, the '--insecure' flag is used by glanceclient to either validate
all SSL certificates or none. Fixes bug 1003711.

Change-Id: Ia9c9b762d2d474767984b4729bb50a8b78d6cb3f

[{'created': '2012-07-27 19:22:35.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: Use instance uuid when calling DB API

The preferred form of calling the DB API is to use the instance UUID
instead of the older instance id. Update that and use the dict form
to be more compatible with blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Ib1a06b5385ec627f3daad5bafb3fa1be956a64e2
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: Use instance uuid when calling DB API

The preferred form of calling the DB API is to use the instance UUID
instead of the older instance id. Update that and use the dict form
to be more compatible with blueprint no-db-messaging.

Change-Id: Ib1a06b5385ec627f3daad5bafb3fa1be956a64e2

commit_message:
Fix multiple distro dependency bug

get_packages() icorrectly handled multiple distros listed in a dependency
file, such as:

    xyz  # dist:fred,barney,wilma

Change-Id: Ib1178b2aaaddafe581902b32776180bb0b41f1ae
(cherry picked from commit 3ea11129012b9ffdf5f38724e11fa9efda9362f5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-27 19:54:46.000000000', 'message': "Correct host count in instance_usage_audit_log extension.

This fixes bug 1030106. Basically we were not counting disabled hosts
in the total host count. Also I have refactored the get_audit_task_logs
method, it's really part of the extension (only the extension uses it),
so I've moved it out of nova.compute.utils into the extension itself.

(the tests that exercise it already lived in the extension's tests anyway.)

Change-Id: Iaf42d887b824ba0cbf6ab0ed143a4c01b37b0cb1
"}]
commit_message:
Correct host count in instance_usage_audit_log extension.

This fixes bug 1030106. Basically we were not counting disabled hosts
in the total host count. Also I have refactored the get_audit_task_logs
method, it's really part of the extension (only the extension uses it),
so I've moved it out of nova.compute.utils into the extension itself.

(the tests that exercise it already lived in the extension's tests anyway.)

Change-Id: Iaf42d887b824ba0cbf6ab0ed143a4c01b37b0cb1

commit_message:
Add '--insecure' commandline argument

Allows to ignore validation errors that typically occur with self-signed
SSL certificates. Making this explicit is important as one would
typically only use this in development or in-house deployments.

This should also fix bug 1012591.

Change-Id: I1210fafc9257648c902176fbcfae9d47e47fc557

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-07-27 17:45:02.000000000', 'message': 'Remove ugly instance._rescue hack

The XenAPI driver would use _rescue to note when an instance was in
the process of being rescued. The existance of this attribute would
modify the 'name' property to append '-rescue' to the generated name.

Among the problems with it, it wasn't saved anywhere (with resulting
code to set it to False being unnecessary) and it led to "magic" code
(see instance.name) that was confusing without understanding the hack.

Change-Id: I1a91e4efdf69d4c1fba07658419f7bb30b733b5a
'}, {'created': '2012-07-27 19:18:49.000000000', 'message': 'Remove ugly instance._rescue hack

The XenAPI driver would use _rescue to note when an instance was in
the process of being rescued. The existance of this attribute would
modify the 'name' property to append '-rescue' to the generated name.

Among the problems with it, it wasn't saved anywhere (with resulting
code to set it to False being unnecessary) and it led to "magic" code
(see instance.name) that was confusing without understanding the hack.

Change-Id: I1a91e4efdf69d4c1fba07658419f7bb30b733b5a
'}]
commit_message:
Remove ugly instance._rescue hack

The XenAPI driver would use _rescue to note when an instance was in
the process of being rescued. The existance of this attribute would
modify the 'name' property to append '-rescue' to the generated name.

Among the problems with it, it wasn't saved anywhere (with resulting
code to set it to False being unnecessary) and it led to "magic" code
(see instance.name) that was confusing without understanding the hack.

Change-Id: I1a91e4efdf69d4c1fba07658419f7bb30b733b5a

commit_message:
Convert to using dict style key lookups in XenAPI

Fixes bug 1030073

With instances being passed as dicts via the RPC API, uses of the instance
object should use dict style key lookups instead of attribute style
lookups.

Change-Id: Iefc0e403d440aada68b259ded457166ad10699fd

commit_message:
Have non-empty image properties in image.delete payload.

This patch uses the image data that is present before the image is actually
deleted as the image.delete notification payload data.

Fixes bug 1028081

Change-Id: Ia1dbdbdf84a4dbaabca8395f9539e58936589563

commit_message:
Sanitize xenstore keys for metadata injection

Xenstore only allows certain characters in key names.  Change disallowed
characters as well as '/' to '_'.

Fixes bug 1029773

Change-Id: I04055bfbe662f3f3e9d90336d03670aa5468e780

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-07-25 22:26:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-26 23:51:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not merge

I don't buy this change. Why not allow internal clients of the db layer to see deleted properties when looking for a deleted image?

And please keep arbitrary changes out of patches like this. You don't need to rename delete_image_metadata to delete_image."}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-07-27 14:03:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hey Waldon,

"I don't buy this change. Why not allow internal clients of the db layer to see deleted properties when looking for a deleted image?"

What do you mean here exactly?

I don't buy deleting image properties and members just because we are deleting the image. The properties and members are still describing the image, even if it is deleted. I think properties and members should only be marked deleted if they are deleted explicitly.


"And please keep arbitrary changes out of patches like this. You don't need to rename delete_image_metadata to delete_image."

Ah I see, I thought I did need to rename delete_image_metadata because I changed what it did but now I get it.'}, {'account_id': 927, 'date': '2012-07-27 14:16:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Waldon:

If you delete properties after the image is deleted, you can no longer tell the difference between properties deleted as part of the image deletion and properties deleted explicitly prior to deletion.

There's no extra space used by doing it this way (since we just mark as deleted), and as Alex says those properties still describe that image.

If operators want to reap properties from the db, its a slightly more complicated sql statement, but still a very reasonable ones (check if the image is deleted instead of just the properties)."}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-07-27 14:19:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-07-27 14:44:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build successful

- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-merge/1433/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-pep8/1554/consoleFull : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-python26/1066/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-glance-python27/1065/testReport : SUCCESS
- https://jenkins.openstack.org/job/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/5099/testReport : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-27 15:32:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

So my biggest concern is the ever-growing database. My understanding is that 'deleted' rows could be dropped safely by a database administrator to prevent the database from growing too large. If we have an image with a billion properties and we delete that image (set deleted=True), then how will we know we can delete those billion properties?"}, {'account_id': 927, 'date': '2012-07-27 15:49:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

We can just delete all properties from glance.properties that have an image ID that either matches a row in images where it is deleted, or where there is no matching row in images (in the case where the admin has already deleted the image).  It is slightly more complicated SQL but nothing crazy.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-27 15:56:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

But then we're making the simple deleted=True convention mean less and deployers will have to know about this special case, right? We're just moving complexity. Why not keep the complexity in the code where it belongs?"}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-07-27 16:19:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

And this really feels like we're treating a symptom of the problem. Why are we trying to notify with an image that has been deleted? That image is gone as far as the calling code is concerned. This concept of setting deleted=True is also an implementation detail of the sqlalchemy driver. We shouldn't be depending on it like this.

We can either throw the notification as soon as the DELETE call is received, which might make sense from a billing perspective, or we could sure we have the image before we call db.api.image_destroy. Have you looked into either of those approaches?"}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-07-27 17:43:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thanks for the reviews so far. 

I'm gonna mp a simpler patch that just notifies with the image object that was gotten before the image is deleted. However this makes it so the payload has "deleted=False" which isn't true.

If setting deleted is an implementation detail then we should stop the db layer from returning the deleted attribute. 

here's the MP
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10420/'}, {'account_id': 177, 'date': '2012-07-27 18:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Abandoned

alternate solution in other MP'}]

commit_message:
Stop properties from being deleted when an image is deleted.

This patch is similar to a change in nova:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/9450/.

This stops image properties and members from being set to deleted when an image
is deleted, allowing the retrieval of this information for notifications.

Fixes bug 1028081

Change-Id: I475b22fdc2c8acb0e2af57e4a10fc81d7727721e

commit_message:
Don't store system_metadata in xenstore

Fixes bug 1029774

system_metadata should not be exposed to users.

This reverts part of commit 82afe7ad5 / ChangeID I88a59f1b783

Change-Id: Id454dbcbafef861db3f88620a56d8dd2ccd30e1d

Overall, this looks good. I'm a bit concerned about the increased chattiness here. I have to wonder if it's time to start looking into leveraging the different message priorities. Right now, almost every notification in Nova is shoved into the INFO queues. These seem like a lower priority notification; useful, but not strictly necessary. What do you think?"}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2012-07-26 20:30:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 2537, 'date': '2012-07-26 20:33:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Matt: Yes, definitely seems like a lot of notifications going into INFO. commit_message:
Implements notifications for more instance changes

Now sends a notification of other changes in the instance besides state
changes. Adds access_ip in notifications as well.

fixes bug 1028559

Change-Id: I664e6b858eda17dd732927f2c9b259212084a8fa

The bug description explains that config_drive was not intended to be a part of the core functionality but an extension.
